comments.body: What version does upstream recommend, as they typically establish a baseline.

`Building Spark using Maven requires Maven 3.3.3 or newer and Java 7+`

But I was actually pegging it because I didn't want the Zeppelin build process to go all over the process (in the mythical world where an `openjdk-9-jdk` gets released).
(And yes, I realize we're not building Spark in this image, I'm just pegging the JDK for the runtime.)
(And I didn't even push a new image, because `:latest` is actually == `:openjdk-8-jdk` right now.)

simple scan of the zeppelin docs show java 1.7 - https://zeppelin.incubator.apache.org/docs/install/install.html

maybe that means 1.7 only or 1.7+, pinning on java 8 start makes sense

Yeah, it seems to be function on JDK8, but I could kick it back if you want. Sorry, I did notice that pre-req as well and presumed it meant 1.7+. Other parts of that page are slightly in need of editing, too.
i'd say stick w/ the 1.7+ assumption until something goes wrong
Why are you pulling in hadoop?  The versions you download are prebuilt against hadoop2.6.

The versions are prebuilt against Hadoop, but don't ship the Hadoop native libraries, nor does the image have them on there. See https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/16320#discussion_r43166287 for the warning this generates. This is actually only pulling in the native libraries (note that the `tar` only extracts the native lib directory), which is a handful of megabytes, versus pulling in all of Hadoop.

@zmerlynn fyi, it's unclear which platform (arch + os + jvm ver) those native libs are built for. i'd guess it is a 64-bit arch, which is good. but os (glibc etc) and jvm are a mystery to me. so adding the native libs may limit portability of the image itself.

however, i don't object to asking for forgiveness - when someone tries to use the image and it fails we can find a way to fix it.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +12,16 @@RUN mkdir -p /opt && \
    cd /opt && \
    wget http://www.us.apache.org/dist/hadoop/common/hadoop-${hadoop_ver}/hadoop-${hadoop_ver}.tar.gz && \
    tar -zvxf hadoop-${hadoop_ver}.tar.gz hadoop-${hadoop_ver}/lib/native && \
    rm hadoop-${hadoop_ver}.tar.gz && \
